justification: "Three questionnaires were administered in Experiment 2 … The Need for Cognition (NFC) scale (Cacioppo, Petty, Feinstein, & Jarvis, 1996)" – explicitly naming the NFC scale as the instrument used to assess the Need for Cognition construct.

measured_by: short version of the UPPS-P Impulsive Behavior Scale (SUPPS-P)
justification: The article notes that participants completed "the short version of the UPPS-P Impulsive Behavior Scale (SUPPS-P; Cyders, Littlefield, Coffey, & Karyadi, 2014)", indicating this measure was used to capture impulsive behaviour traits.

It states that a "short questionnaire designed to evaluate individuals' sunk-cost tendency … coined the Wastefulness Questionnaire (Bogdanov, Ruff, & Schwabe, 2017)" was administered, linking the construct to the instrument.
The same sentence describes the Wastefulness Questionnaire as measuring the "desire for not appearing as wasteful," tying this construct to that questionnaire.

measured_by: two-stage cognitive effort investment task (progress sunk-cost paradigm)
justification: Participants "were asked to complete a two-stage cognitive effort investment task … to compare investment decisions with no prior investment against decisions following high (or low) levels of cognitive effort"; this task operationalised and measured individuals’ sensitivity to sunk effort costs.
